actions.committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy

official_title: To convert from a convoluted and costly system for issuing circulating currency that requires an enormous amount of debt and annual interest to a more logical system that does not involve debt or interest in connection with the issuance of circulating currency, and for other purposes.
short_title: Circulating Currency Simplification and Cost-saving Act

summary.text: Circulating Currency Simplification and Cost-saving Act - Declares that: (1) all Federal reserve notes issued by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall be the obligation of the United States and be deemed to be U.S. currency notes; and (2) all Board assets and liabilities with respect to the issuance of such Federal reserve notes shall be transferred to the Secretary of the Treasury, and be assets and liabilities of the United States.

titles.title: Circulating Currency Simplification and Cost-saving Act

To convert from a convoluted and costly system for issuing circulating currency that requires an enormous amount of debt and annual interest to a more logical system that does not involve debt or interest in connection with the issuance of circulating currency, and for other purposes.
